Overview: Are you fascinated by the power of marketing on culture and society? Do you have an insatiable appetite to learn and build new things? Does the idea of innovating the marketing industry bring out the scientist AND the artist in you? If you’re excited about seeing your work come to life across the many faces of the internet, then read on. Methods+Mastery has an immediate opening for a talented data scientist to work on Fortune 50 tech brands. This position offers the opportunity for a hybrid set-up with work from home and work from office flexibility. Our ideal candidate is a born collaborator with excellent communication skills and solid machine learning fundamentals. We are a close knit team that takes huge pride in the work we produce, and our new data scientist will be key in taking that work to the next level. To be successful, you must possess a voracious appetite to learn, grow, work hard, and have fun. If you are curious and inventive and are someone who is not afraid to push the boundaries of marketing science and drive our clients to new levels of innovative thinking, we encourage you to apply. Methods+Mastery is an entrepreneurial, collaborative environment that values talented, creative people who like to work with others to create cutting-edge programs for our clients. We work on projects ranging from regional to global in scope for some resume bolstering brands. If you’d like to hang, you’ll have the opportunity to contribute against the full spectrum of marketing science work we do, such as building custom NLP models, time series forecasting and predictive modeling, causality testing, and automating methodologies and processes so that we can do things better and faster. We believe a diverse team brings a wider range of personal and professional experiences and perspectives, and we recognize that diversity and inclusion benefit our agency, our clients, and the communities in which we work and live. To that end, we strongly encourage applications from women, people of color, members of the LGBTQ community, veterans, and individuals with disabilities. Sound like what you’re looking for? Give us a shout.  Responsibilities: Responsibilities: Use machine learning and statistical techniques to understand how earned media and social media impacts a client’s brand and reputation Work with large datasets for A/B testing, model development and validation, time series analysis, and graph analytics Collaborate with members of the Intelligence Lab to concept, build, and deploy products used across the M+M organization Qualifications: Qualifications: 2+ years of experience working in Data Science 2+ years of experience with Machine Learning, Forecasting, Computer Vision, and/or Natural Language Processing (NLP) 2+ years of experience working with at least one major machine learning Python library (Scikit-learn, PyTorch, Tensorflow, etc.) Ability to handle the ambiguity of juggling multiple projects, deadlines, and evolving client priorities Experience working with social media or earned media data is a plus Experience working for a consulting firm is a plus

NEIMAN MARCUS GROUP   For over a century, Neiman Marcus Group has served the unique needs of our discerning customers by staying true to the principles of our founders: to be the premier omni-channel retailer of luxury and fashion merchandise dedicated to providing superior service and a distinctive shopping experience in our stores and on our websites. Neiman Marcus Group is comprised of the Specialty Retail Stores division, which includes Neiman Marcus and Bergdorf Goodman. Our portfolio of brands offers the finest luxury and fashion apparel, accessories, jewelry, beauty, and home décor. The Company operates more than 40 Neiman Marcus full-line stores in the most affluent markets across the United States, including U.S. gateway cities that draw an international clientele. In addition, we operate 2 Bergdorf Goodman stores in landmark locations on Fifth Avenue in New York City. We also operate 5 Last Call by Neiman Marcus off-price stores that cater to a value oriented, yet fashion minded customer. Our upscale eCommerce and direct-to-consumer division includes NeimanMarcus.com, BergdorfGoodman.com Horchow.com and LastCall.com. Every day each of our 13,000 NMG associates work towards the goal of enabling our customers to shop any of our brands "anytime, anywhere, and on any device." Whether the merchandise we sell, the customer service we offer, or our investments in technology, everything we do is to enhance the customer experience across all channels and brands.   Job Summary  A Data Scientist in Neiman Marcus Group (NMG) deepens customers’ relationship, enhances customers’ magical luxury shopping experience, and increases luxury customers’ CLVs by applying algorithms. The Data Scientist performs statistical and econometric analysis, AI/ML modeling, and numerical optimization. The Data Scientist solves use cases related to personalization, customer engagement, marketing promotions, merchandise planning, supply chain, pricing, and cost. This position will lead data science needs across all Neiman Marcus Group brands, divisions and selling channels.   Job Duties  The position reports to the Manager or Senior Manager of Decision Science  Collaborates with cross-organization to ideate and prioritize use cases, business problems, and user stories that can enhance customers experience and increase NMG ROI.  Leads data science projects independently while collaborating with team members and multi-organizational stakeholders.  Develops statistical, econometric, AI/ML, and numerical optimization models for personalization, customer engagement, marketing science, retail analytics, business analytics, and supply-chain analytics using big data in cloud environment to improve customer satisfaction and promote growth.  Leverages state-of-the-art data science tools, methodologies, and algorithms to drive improved decisions  Collaborates in the development and implementation of predictive models, segmentation strategies, optimization algorithms, and data mining analyses with a targeted result of increasing revenue.  Researches, innovates, and designs algorithms and techniques to contribute in optimization and automation.  Continuously learns new skills  May be allowed to work from home or from remote location in the USA   Qualifications   At least a quant-based undergraduate degree such as Computer Science, Electrical Engineering, Math, Statistics, Physics, Economics, or other related fields from a reputed university with course work that includes analytics, coding, statistics, math, and algorithm development. Ph.D. is Preferred  Strong in Math, Statistic, Finance, and Econometric  Expert Level skills in at least two of the followings: a) graph/network theory, b) personalized recommendation engine, c) statistical modeling and linear/non-linear optimization theory, d) machine learning and neural Network  1+ years of hands on experience in Data Science.  Experience in working in retail space will be a plus.  Strong coding skills in Python and SQL  Experience in using Keras, Tensorflow, and scikit-learn  Experience in working on Spark, AWS SageMaker, S3, and SnowFlake is a plus   Primary Location :  United States of America-Texas-DALLAS-Irving-Remote Dallas Work Locations :  Remote Dallas Neiman Marcus 5950 Colwell Blvd Irving 75039 Job :  E-Commerce Organization :  Corporate Schedule :  Full-time Shift :  Day Employee Status :  Regular Job Type :  Standard Job Level :  Individual Contributor Travel :  No Job Posting :  Sep 17, 2021, 5:17:18 PM

At Freese and Nichols, everyone on our team gets to make a meaningful difference in our communities. Our unique culture creates an environment for professional growth where we focus on caring for our clients, coworkers, and the communities where we work. Join our team of 1,000 employees as we continue to expand our services throughout the United States. Learn more about working here at  freese.com/careers . Responsible for supporting the development and expansion of a service line providing technical business intelligence, data science, and data engineering expertise for data collection, pipelines, storage, analytics, and visualization. As part of our Management Consulting team and in partnership with our technical teams across the company, this position will help identify, prioritize, scope, and execute business intelligence and data science initiatives to foster a culture of data-driven decision making. The Data Scientist will work with other technical subject matter experts to establish company standards in analytic methodologies, tools, skill development paths, and applications maintenance. This position includes opportunities to develop and manage a team of data engineers, data scientists, and data analysts, actively participate in the team’s work, and provide ongoing thought leadership around data science and business intelligence vision / roadmap to the broader Management Consulting team and the company overall. Qualifications Business Intelligence and Data Science Coordinate and execute initiatives focused on transforming data into actionable insights informing FNI’s clients’ business decisions through our professional services. Use available business intelligence tools (e.g., Power BI, Esri ArcGIS) to design dynamic data products with analytical findings best suited for sponsoring departments’ needs. (e.g., dashboards, maps, graphs, charts) When appropriate, coordinate application of more advanced data science principles to meet department needs. (e.g., regression analysis, forecasting, machine learning, natural language processing) Coordinate the preparation of different types of data from separate and distinct data storage sources for analysis, including data transformation, cleaning, and normalizing, using tools, methods, and programming languages. (e.g., R, Python, SQL) Identify and coordinate data engineering and database administration roles establishing appropriate data storage and extract, transform, and load (ETL) pipelines for required data services on clients’ projects. Project Coordination and Execution Develop data-driven solutions for internal and external clients’ needs. Assist in the identification of business intelligence analysts, data scientists, data engineers, and database administrators to execute projects from conception to completion. Develop approaches to deliver high quality data products meeting internal and external clients’ expectations. Identify approaches to engage additional resources when needed on projects, including within Freese and Nichols (FNI), hiring, and through teaming partnerships. Facilitate ‘business development’ activities with FNI’s technical service lines, assisting in scoping projects to deliver data products that inform key strategic and business decisions. Data Governance and Management In coordination with a select team of FNI leadership, support the development and implementation of the data management policies and data management plans for the effective and secure acquisition, storage, and use of data for internal and external clients. Coordinate approaches and technical standards with FNI’s Business Technology team for effective data governance and management. EA SPORTS is one of the leading sports entertainment brands in the world, with top-selling video game franchises, award-winning interactive technology, fan programs, and cross-platform digital experiences.  The Challenge Ahead: As a Data Scientist you will help improve our Madden NFL franchise through the personalization of the player experience. You are a technically-oriented individual, knowledgeable of how to use data and experimentation to solve product problems. You report to a central analytics and data science team, but work directly with producers, designers, product managers on the Madden team to directly influence game design to create an ever more dynamic player journey in our titles.  What a Data Scientist does at EA: Translate business and product questions into ethical and mathematically sound experiments. Understand how to use principles of machine learning to help learn and tune in game experiences while understanding their consequences. Build models, analyses, and reports that support and grow our understanding of the gameplay experience, partnering with producers, designers, and other data scientists. Document and present analysis and modeling projects, methodologies, and conclusions to both peers and partners. Support peers with technical reviews, ensuring quality coding and deployment practices. Requirements MS or greater in a field such as Mathematics, Computer Science, Economics, Statistics. 2 or more years of experience in data science, analytics, or a related area in a consumer products-oriented industry. SQL skills, including experience querying complex data sets such as platforms like Apache Hive. Experience developing statistical and machine learning models using languages like Python, R, or Ruby. Experience with experimental design and the determination of the statistical significance of findings. Knowledge of programming best practices, version control, and automation. Experience presenting and prioritizing with people at multiple levels of business and technical expertise. We love to celebrate our great perks like comprehensive health and benefit packages, tuition reimbursement, 401k with company match, of course, free video games and more!

There are over 7 billion people on this planet. And by 2050, there will be 2 billion more... many moving into urban centers at an unprecedented rate. Making sure there is enough food, fiber and infrastructure for our rapidly growing world is what we're all about. And it's why we're investing in our people and our technology like never before! You will work with some of the world's brightest minds are taking on the biggest technical challenges. If you want to be tackle hard technical challenges alongside excellent people and make the world a better, we want to work with you!  Our people are at the heart of what we do. Through cross-discipline collaboration, this mission-driven and daring team is eager to define the new frontier of agricultural robotics. We are always asking hard questions, rapidly iterating, and getting our boots in the field to figure it out. We won't give up until we've made a tangible and positive impact on agriculture.  Position  Summary:   John Deere's mission is that our customers are the world's most profitable and sustainable farmers. Within John Deere, the Sustainability Solutions team is operating as a start-up. In less than a year since our team was formed, we quickly launched two pilots. One helps cotton farmers easily measure and improve their sustainability metrics, and is on track to scale from Beta to Production in 2022. The other pilot helps farmers participate in agricultural carbon markets easily by reducing the time required to fill out paperwork from days to minutes. We help farmers measure & reduce their carbon footprint, and leverage John Deere Financial to reduce the cost barriers for farmers switching to sustainable practices.  This is a remote position.   Required skills/experiences:   2+ years experience (5+ for senior) working as a data scientist or equivalent  M.S. in computer science, engineering, data science, or similar quantitative field  Experience in creating data science strategy to align with product needs in an ambiguous and fast moving environment  Identifying and integrating with relevant 3rd party technology providers  Proficient in python & SQL  Familiarity with at least one of the following specialty areas: geospatial analytics, remote sensing, building empirical models of physical systems.  Passion for sustainability   Preferred Skills:   Domain knowledge in agriculture or an enthusiastic willingness to learn  Understanding how to drive a cohesive tech design and tech identity.  You are willing to roll up your sleeves, build solid relationships, serve as a key player to our technology organization.  Working at Deere  At John Deere, you are empowered to build the career of your dreams. Here, you'll enjoy the freedom to explore new projects, the support to solve problems creatively and the sophisticated tools and technology that cultivate innovation and achievement. We offer comprehensive relocation and reward packages to help you get started on your new career path. Click here to find out more about our Total Rewards Package. At AT&T, we bring the world together with technology in ways you never imagined. Whether it’s your next big idea or the newest innovation, we’re looking for people like you to lead the way. Your creative solutions could impact innovations across telecommunications, high-speed Internet and pay TV. It’s an opportunity to combine your passions for entertainment, media, and technology to transform our company and your career. Step into a future with AT&T.  This role can be in Dallas, TX; El Segundo, CA; or Atlanta, GA; however, other locations will be considered.  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will work on highly visible, fast-moving projects which require business acumen and strong technical skills. You’ll work directly with our client community to define requirements then design and develop solutions that are architecturally sound, scalable, and adhere to the team defined frameworks.  You’ll be a “go-to” subject matter expert on the sourcing data for one or more of AT&T’s major products. You’ll be able to create data structures and process that support marketing campaigns, advanced analytics, and predictive modeling.  Details:  Gather, analyze, and interpret a wide variety of data to identify relationships.  Projects include direct/digital campaigns and analytical initiatives.  Develop and maintain automated ETL processes to move data between disparate data sources, leveraging scripting tools such as SQL, Python etc.  Source and understand complex data sets across complex web of AT&T systems including Teradata, Vertica, Oracle, Data Lakes, Palantir.  Develop design, develop business ready datasets, self-service data tools, and proof of concepts etc. using cutting edge cloud technologies.  Work with business partners and vendors directly and deliver the projects through a mix of development, data analyses, insights, skills capabilities  Qualifications:  5-8 Years of related, relevant experience to include:  Good SQL knowledge in RDBMS such as Teradata, Vertica etc.  Experience with Spark applications using PySpark and Spark-SQL for data manipulation.  Experience leveraging advanced big data manipulation techniques.  Experience designing solutions from scratch with limited oversight.  Design, build, implement, and deliver scalable Microsoft Azure Cloud solutions.  Demonstrated ability to communicate in verbal and written form clearly and concisely  Demonstrated Critical thinking / Problem solving.  Experience in Databricks and Deltalake is a plus.  Salesforce Marketing Cloud platform experience is highly desired.  Tableau or PowerBI experience is a plus.  Bachelor’s degree or advanced degree in Mathematics, Engineering and or Computer Science or Ph.D. in related fields preferred   Ready to join our team? Apply today!  Our Senior Data Analysis earn between $84900 – $158400 yearly. Not to mention all of the other amazing rewards that working at AT&T offers. From health insurance to tuition reimbursement and paid time off to discounts on products and services just to name a few. There is a lot to be excited about around here.

We are an ambitious, well-funded, high-growth global technology company transforming the hotel industry. At Duetto, we are passionate about creating innovative solutions to help hoteliers thrive. Although we work hard and operate at "Duetto speed", we pay attention to customer centricity, simplicity, collaboration, scalability, innovation and most of all, fun.  We are seeking a unicorn to join our industry leading technology team co-founded by the former CTO of salesforce.com. Our technology toolbox includes AWS, Athena, python, time series analysis and decomposition, clustering and data visualization.  As a Data Analyst in the Analytics team, you will report into the Head of Analytics. You are the domain expert and bring to the table your industry experience, analytical skills, and deep knowledge of the relevant data. Your daily duties would include data transformations, data analysis, anomaly detection, and developing repeatable methods to ensure data integrity and presentation of insights via data visualizations. You will collaborate closely with engineers, data scientists and product managers to build the next generation data models, algorithms and insights that help customers (hotels, resorts, casinos, etc.) to maximize their revenue.  Desired Skills & Expertise   Expert in core revenue management concepts such as demand forecasting, yield management, pricing, channel optimization, etc, ideally from the hospitality or airline industry.   Experience in utilizing a wide array of datasets to construct models for demand room, revenue forecasting and optimization, possibly including working with constrained inventory models such as hotel rooms, airline seats, or ad tech.   Experience using SQL and statistical computer languages such as R or Python to manipulate data and draw insights from large and complex datasets.  Experience with data warehouses such as Athena, BigQuery or Snowflake, ability to create, manage and refine large numbers of data entities as tables and views.  Experience in using data visualization tools such as Tableau or Looker for large datasets.  Knowledge of statistical techniques and concepts such as time-series data analysis, decomposition and forecasting algorithms.  Nice to have knowledge of machine learning techniques or experience with machine learning pipelines.   An obsession in solving customer problems in revenue management using big data and technology.   About Duetto:  We are a team of passionate hospitality and technology professionals delivering a modern platform to hoteliers in over 60 countries. Our solutions address the biggest problems faced by the hospitality industry by simplifying distribution complexity and optimizing profitability with unique and powerful applications that increase conversion, guest loyalty, operational efficiency and revenue. Our goal is to become the most trusted, effective and widely used hotel technology company in the world. Founded in 2012, Duetto is headquartered in San Francisco with offices in Las Vegas, London, Singapore and Buenos Aires. Duetto is backed by leading investors: Warburg Pincus, Accel Partners, Icon Ventures, and Battery Ventures. If you want to be a part of a fast-growing company, working with amazing people tackling big challenges in a massive industry, then Duetto is looking for you.

JOB TITLE:  Applied Data Scientist POSITION CODE:  70234756 ORG UNIT NAME:  Corporate Technology & Innovation LOCATION:  USA – Houston, TX  ABOUT SABIC SABIC is a global leader in chemicals headquartered in Riyadh, Saudi Arabia. From making cars and planes more fuel-efficient, to helping conserve the world’s water supply and enabling colorful smartphone cases, we find solutions to the challenges of today to help our customers achieve their ambitions and build a better tomorrow.  At SABIC, we combine a rich track record of doing what others said couldn’t be done, with a deep understanding of our customers. But our true impact is as a partner who can help our customers achieve their ambitions by finding solutions to their challenges. We call this ‘Chemistry that Matters™’ JOB SUMMARY SABIC Data & Computational Science team is a growing organization providing statistical leadership throughout the different Technology and Innovation Centers in USA, Asia Pacific, Europe, and KSA. This position offers an excellent career opportunity for a data scientist to leverage applied statistics/ data science methodology in broad-based application areas from product development to process optimization, reliability as well as digitalization in Petrochemical Industry. JOB PURPOSE AND RESPONSIBILITIES Act as statistical focal point leading the application of statistical methodology, providing statistical direction on high-level priority projects and developing approaches for nonstandard statistical problems. Provide expertise and consultation on complex problems supporting statistical methods in combination with machine learning and big data technology in manufacturing across SABIC. Traveling and extended stay at a site may be required. Working closely with scientists, managers, and teams, providing statistical expertise in a variety of multivariate and experimental design methods leading to the development or improvement of products or processes globally. Participate in the assessment and introduction of new data technology supporting digitalization and automation efforts for application to a broader practice within the organization. Carry out advanced statistical analysis in combination with machine learning and artificial intelligence and build group capability. Coordinating the training and deployment of key statistical concepts for scientist and engineers as well as teaching seminars in applied statistical methods, data mining, multivariate analysis and design of experiments. Also collaboration with Universities, research institutions, publishing, and presenting the work to the wider applied statistical community. Provide direction and mentor junior scientist Introduce state of the art techniques for data analysis and predictive modeling to expedite completion of R&D projects Evaluate technologies and advice leadership about techniques and services offered Develop and implement new algorithms for predictive modeling of material properties Design study protocol and statistical approach for formulation development Develop statistical solutions to complex problems MINIMUM EDUCATION/EXPERIENCE REQUIREMENTS Minimum of three years relevant experience in related field, with a PhD (greater number of years of experience with lesser degree of education) Demonstrated experience in use of data based models to optimize industrial processes is preferred. Demonstrated experience in development of hybrid models (combination of first-principles and data based models) is preferred. Experience in predictive modeling, statistics, machine learning to collect, explore and extract insight from structured and unstructured data. Ability to carry out advanced data analyses Experience with computer-generated optimal design of experiments, preferred Background in Machine learning would be a plus Ability to work in collaborative multidisciplinary scientific environment Ability to communicate technical results to non-statisticians Experience developing and implementing statistical models, machine learning and analytics Experience with statistical applications in chemistry and engineering Proficiency with statistical software packages including SAS and JMP ELIGIBILITY REQUIREMENTS You must submit your application for employment online to be considered. Please submit your resume using the “Apply Now/Apply” option on this page. You must be 18 years or older You must be willing to take a drug test as part of the selection process You must be willing to submit to a background investigation as part of the selection process You must have unrestricted authorization to work in the United States Relocation if available SABIC is committed to creating a diverse work environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer and as such will not discriminate in its employment practices, including recruiting and hiring practices, based on a person’s race, color, religion, national origin, citizenship, sex (including gender identity, sexual orientation and pregnancy), age, disability, genetic information, veteran status, or other characteristics protected by law. Please, no phone calls or emails to any employee of SABIC about this opening. All resumes submitted by search firms/employment agencies to any employee at SABIC via-email, the Internet or in any form and/or method without a valid written search firm agreement in place for this position will be deemed the sole property of SABIC; no fee will be paid in the event a candidate is hired by SABIC as a result of the unsolicited referral or through other means

Our mission is to help people everywhere find a job and company they love. We're transforming the workplace experience through the power of transparency. It's no secret that the cost of living and other economic considerations vary widely across the country and the world.  At Glassdoor we apply a "tier" system to promote consistency in level of compensation for where roles are filled in different locations. The tiers are as follows:   Tier 1 encompasses the highest salary range for states where large metropolitan areas are located (ie: San Francisco, New York City, Washington DC, & etc)  Tier 2 encompasses salary ranges 15% less than those in Tier 1 for states with mid-sized cities (ie: Chicago, Dallas, Portland, etc)  Tier 3 encompasses salary ranges 20% less than those in Tier 1 for states with smaller  cities (including our Ohio office, Nevada, etc)   You can learn more about our compensation philosophy  here  and see salary ranges for all Glassdoor jobs  here . Experienced with coding in R, Python or Pyspark and using Machine Learning or regressions to explain and predict business outcomes.  Thorough knowledge in statistics and experience with ideating, designing and analyzing A/B tests.  Strong visualization skills and experience with BI tools (ex. Tableau).   For more information about some of the exciting technology work being done at Glassdoor, check out our Engineering Blog!  Why Glassdoor?   100% company paid medical/dental/vision/life coverage, with 80% dependent coverage.  Equity Incentives in our parent company's ADR (Recruit Holdings, Stock ID: 6098T).  Annual 10% bonus aligning with bi-annual performance reviews.  401(k) Plan with a Company Match to prepare for your future.  Generous paid holidays and open paid time off. Who we're looking for Toyota Motors North America’s (TMNA) Information Technology Department is looking for a Sr Data Scientist for the Marketing and Consumer portfolio within the CTO organization. The primary responsibility of this role is to build scalable solutions to evaluate the effectiveness of marketing investments, build a feedback loop into the customer data asset based on marketing response, ROI, and attribution. Reporting to the Director of Marketing and Customer Data Science, the person in this role will support the Marketing Technology and Analytics department's objective to evaluate the effectiveness of our marketing investments with use cases spanning across the marketing mix, attribution, ROI, and customer intelligence. This position is eligible for remote work from the following states: AL, AZ, CA, CO, GA, IL, IN, IA, KY, MD, MA, MI, MS, MO, NJ, NY, OH, OR, TN, TX, DC or WV. What you’ll be doing Conduct analyses on large data set to extract insights that will guide our marketing investments. Use machine learning and deep learning to evaluate marketing investment effectiveness (MMM & MTA, to name a few) and help achieve the greatest possible value. Use a flexible, analytical approach to design, develop, and evaluate predictive models and advanced algorithms that lead to optimal value extraction from the data. Run experimentation initiatives, design test plans, obtain cross-functional alignment, complete robust analysis, and deliver practical insights. Build and maintain various pipelines required for model deployment and continuous operations around models. Communicate/build products to deliver data-driven insights and recommendations to non-technical audiences through clear visualizations and presentations. Lead and manage a data science team to build, deploy and monitor data science modes. Collaborate with other data science teams at Toyota to use shared platforms, enterprise standards, best practices to deliver insights and innovations. What you bring Intellectually curious with all things data, a very skilled communicator who focuses as much on delivering insights as you do on the underlying technical solution. Expert analytical skills include analyzing and modeling big data using statistics, machine learning, and deep learning. Strong SQL and Python experience desired. Strong understanding of digital media strategy and the ever-evolving attribution landscape; Experience with Probabilistic Multi-touch attribution and Marketing Mix Models. Experienced in taking vague questions and crystallizing them into impactful experiments, analyses, or models. Experience with leading/managing a data science team. You have a degree in a quantitative field, such as Computer Science/Engineering, Mathematics, Statistics, Economics; an advanced degree is desirable. Experience with batch and API model deployment in the cloud, best practices on model monitoring, and running operations around machine learning pipelines. Added bonus if you have Experience with ML-based Recommendation Engine. Experience with AI Product development. Experience with Orchestration toolkits like Airflow and Kubeflow. What we’ll bring During your interview process, our team can fill you in on all the details of our industry-leading benefits and career development opportunities. A few highlights include: A work environment built on teamwork, flexibility, and respect. Work with business Product Owners to define and prioritize product backlogs. Support marketing in the creation of business cases related to the portfolio of products. Contribute to planning by demonstrating significant and increasing knowledge about the business strategies of Toyota, as well as competitors and the general industry. Explain how our technology solutions support these business needs. Relocation assistance (if applicable).

Costco is well known for its generosity and community service and has won many awards for its philanthropy. The company joins with its employees to take an active role in volunteering by sponsoring many opportunities to help others. In 2018, Costco contributed over $39 million to organizations such as United Way and Children's Miracle Network Hospitals.  Costco IT is responsible for the  technical future of Costco Wholesale , the second largest retailer in the world with wholesale operations in twelve countries. Despite our size and explosive international expansion, we continue to provide a family, employee centric atmosphere in which our employees thrive and succeed. As proof, Costco consistently ranks in the  top five of Forbes “America’s Best Employers” .  The Data Scientist - Data Analytics is responsible for generating insights and to augment decision making by the business. At Costco, we are on a mission to significantly leverage big data to provide better products and services for our members. This role is focused on advanced analytics, machine learning, and data science delivery to support multiple business areas. This role will partner with Product Owner and business owners to build, test advanced analytics solutions, and turn data into actionable insights. The Data Scientist is a knowledgeable leader with an ability to lead and is passionate about data and using machine learning to solve business problems. The right candidate will have deep knowledge of applying data science for forecasting, customer analysis, item, and inventory management and other areas of retail. We are looking for a highly motivated, customer focused professional who wants to work in a fun and highly collaborative environment and willing to be the player as well as coach for the data science community at Costco  If you want to be a part of one of the   BEST “to work for” companies  in the world , simply apply and let your career be reimagined.  ROLE   Leads the analysis by applying statistics, machine learning, and analytic approaches to predict and optimize business outcomes.  Designs and builds ML/DL models to solve business problems.  Frames a problem and comes up with a hypothesis.  Assesses the effectiveness and accuracy of models on an ongoing basis.  Identifies new data that could enhance the quality and accuracy of models to improve predictions.  Communicates results effectively with storytelling and visualization.  Coaches the team in feature engineering using machine learning techniques.  Performs peer review for another Data Scientist’s work.  Provides feedback to enhance the testing framework and MLOps.  Extends beyond core data science work to perform data wrangling and data preparation as needed.   REQUIRED   Graduate degree in Computer Science, Data Science, and Statistics/Mathematics or equivalent experience.  5+ years’ experience in delivering business insights using advanced statistical and machine learning models and visualization.  Experience using source control tools like Git or Subversion.  Proficiency in working with diverse databases and other data sources.  Strong proficiency in Machine Learning, Statistical, and Reporting tools (Python, R, SQL, PowerBI).  Knowledge of Deep Learning and Neural Networks, and its applications.  Strong experience working in Cloud (AWS, Azure) based analytics platform.   Recommended Knowledge of AzureML and Azure Databricks.  Knowledge of Agile software development. Experience in software development. Exposure to the retail industry.  Experience leading team of data scientists. Excellent verbal and written communication skills. Senior Data Analyst - Marketing Analytics  Data is a key driver in building differentiated customer experiences and enabling stakeholder decision-making at Madison Reed. Our Analytics team pursues an actionable understanding of our customers and our business. We partner with every part of the business to unlock value-driving insights, from Marketing and Digital Product to Supply Chain and Operations. You will join a team focused on identifying and optimizing winning strategies for the business.  As a Senior Data Analyst, you will fuel business growth by generating insights around customer acquisition and retention. You will inform key leaders in Growth, Retention and Consumer Engagement on Madison Reed's growth opportunities and analyze our performance. A successful candidate is compelled by intellectual curiosity to unlock the meaning behind the numbers and enjoys collaborating with others to achieve success. This role will report into the Director of Analytics.   What you will do:    Write SQL queries to pull and manipulate data  Use data to surface insights, create metrics and communicate a point of view about our customers  Create dashboards and measurement plans to establish narratives around business performance  Serve as a strategic partner to the Marketing teams  Gather requirements for necessary data models and predictive analytics solutions   What you will need:   2 - 4 years of professional experience in data analysis, data visualization and business intelligence  Experience in SQL with ability to design and validate complex queries  Experience with the modern data stack (Looker, DBT, Segment, Snowflake)  You are a great storyteller and communicator and can build relationships with a diverse set of stakeholders  Ability to learn quickly and autonomously  Organized and detail-oriented with effective multitasking and prioritization skills  Highly motivated, willing to take ownership of work and a drive to solve problems independently   Big on Benefits:  The Perks? Glad you asked...   Comprehensive Medical, Dental, and Vision Benefits  Generous Paid Time Off program  Company Paid Short and Long Term Disability and Life Insurance  100% Company Paid Mental Health Benefits through Talkspace  HSA Employer Contributions and FSA Options  401k Participation  Parental Leave Program  Learning and Education Programs  Madison Reed Gratis + Discounts on Hair Color Bar Services and Products  Company Sponsored Events + Surprise and Delights  But wait, there's more…   We are Madison Reed.  We're disrupting a $50 billion industry.  Since 2013, we've offered our clients the option to truly own their beauty with a revolutionary choice—your place or ours? At home hair color or Hair Color Bar services? Our business is truly omnichannel, with the option to order or subscribe through our website, pick up in store at our Hair Color Bars, or make an appointment at one of our Hair Color Bar locations (over 50 & growing). At our Hair Color Bars, clients can choose from a variety of color services from licensed cosmetologists—permanent hair color, roots only, hair gloss, highlights and more. With the launch of our men's line in 2020, we're shaking up the $50 billion hair care industry with products that continue to raise the bar for doing your own hair at home.  We live our values.  Here at our San Francisco headquarters and in every Hair Color Bar nationwide, we truly live our values—Love, Joy, Courage, Responsibility, and Trust. Our values inform everything we do, from how we treat our clients to how we treat every member of our fast-growing team. Our founder & CEO, Amy Errett, has fostered a one-of-a-kind culture based on transparency, accountability, and fun; where diversity and inclusion are of utmost importance and every team member feels supported to succeed.  We are hair color that breaks the rules.  Our commitment to the ultimate client experience, paired with our dedication to product innovation and the latest beauty technology, has attracted a devoted, consistently-growing base of fans, converts, and color evangelists. We love what we do—and it shows.  Join us in our mission to live life colorfully and make personal care more personal. Overview: Who we are Imagine working in a place where  continuous improvement  and  innovation  is celebrated and rewarded; where fast-paced, high-impact teams come together to positively drive results for one of the largest & most iconic brands in the world. As the only rapidly growing retailer, you may know us as your friendly neighborhood store. You probably know our familiar name, have seen our pervasive logo, and have tried our highly sought-after products, such as Slurpee® and Big Bite®. “Brain Freeze” is a 7-Eleven registered trademark for our 53-year old Slurpee® and with over 77,000 stores globally (more than any other retailer or food service provider), we sell over 14 million a month. But there’s a lot more to our story and much more left to be written. We are transforming our business, ensuring we are customer obsessed and digitally enabled to seamlessly link our brick and mortar stores with digital products and services.  At 7-Eleven the  entrepreneurial spirit  is in our DNA and has been ever since our inception 90+ years ago. It’s what drove us to invent the convenience industry in 1927 by envisioning how a simple ice dock could provide household staples such as milk and eggs to  better serve the needs of our customers .  Today we are  redefining convenience and the customer experience  in big ways...we are fundamentally changing our culture and we want talented, innovative, customer obsessed, and entrepreneurial people like you to  come make history with us .  How we lead At 7-Eleven we are guided by our  Leadership Principles . Be Customer Obsessed Be Courageous with Your Point of View Challenge the Status Quo Act Like an Entrepreneur Have an “It Can Be Done” Attitude Do the Right Thing Be Accountable Each principle has a defined set of behaviors which help guide the 7-Eleven team to Serve Customers and Support Stores. Implementing system enhancements Plan and direct DevOps implementation and system hardware/software updates for maximum performance and stability. You may also work on the BI dashboards to support retail stores and the Azure AI platform that runs the personalized consumer experiences used by millions each day. This is a hands-on position: 90% of your time will be application design or coding, the rest code is code testing, review and deployment. Are you someone with a passion for data, analytics, insights, and technology? Do you want to work on one of the largest data science teams at Microsoft, lighting up actionable insights that drive key business decisions for the Microsoft Cloud? Team and Role: The goal of the Microsoft Cloud Data Sciences (MCDS) team is to foster a data-driven culture and to encourage & enable the entire organization to make more informed decisions through data. In support of this mission, the MCDS Transformation team works closely with engineering, marketing, finance, sales, and business leaders to identify opportunities for improving the customer experience and accelerating the growth of cloud platforms and services. Our charter spans the breadth of Cloud + AI (Azure, Dynamics, Power Platform, Business Applications) where we surface key insights, identify salient trends, perform analyses of historical data, define benchmarks and models for predicting upcoming performance, and design and deliver standardized views of business performance. The team is passionate about continuous learning: you will join a diverse team focused on developing and applying new skills in an inclusive environment. You can read more about our team’s work on Medium at (https://medium.com/data-science-at-microsoft). We are looking for an experienced Data & Applied Scientist to leverage large-scale data and build insights focused on unlocking new value for Microsoft by understanding product consumption and journey patterns across the Microsoft Cloud. This role is primarily focused on partnering with and enabling the Business Applications organization by providing data science insights such as customer segmentation, pairing recommendations, and other insights derived from data. You will be joining a group of experts on the front lines of synthesizing vast data sets of customer journey and product engagement behavior into targeted recommendations for addressing real world cloud computing business challenges at scale. Responsibilities Responsibilities: o Become a subject matter expert in the Cloud + AI business and underlying data ecosystem, inclusive of the Business Application product group. o Collaborate with product, marketing, and program owners across the Business Applications and central marketing organizations to understand objectives, identify opportunities, and inform data-driven decisions. o Be a storyteller, helping inform our partners on ‘why’, ‘what’ and ‘how’ the data impacts their business and focus areas. o Partner with stakeholders to develop analytical insights, propensity models, and success criteria that will help drive better understanding of customer’s cloud journey and cloud maturity. o Identify changes in customer behavior, system performance, or financial results, and deliver the necessary insights to explain them and recommend actions to be taken. o Deliver accurate and timely reporting and analysis in support of business reviews. Lead the development and management of metrics, KPIs, and dashboards. Recognize opportunities for process improvements to increase quality, accelerate delivery, and reduce cost. o Ensure documentation of analysis methodologies/results and educate users on leveraging data. Qualifications Basic Qualifications:  o Experience leading data analyses from start to finish and landing actionable insights. o 2+ years of experience in data science, analytics, business intelligence, or data driven business strategy. Including hands-on experience in T-SQL or other query languages and data analysis tools (R, Python, Azure Data explorer/Kusto, PowerBI etc.). o Strong analytical ability; problem deconstruction, statistical thinking, meticulous analysis, data validation, and scientific rigor. o Demonstrated stakeholder management, including clear and concise communication, effective prioritization, storytelling/presentation, and delivery of actionable insights. Preferred Qualifications: o Previous product analytics experience where telemetry data was used to understand how customers interacted with a product or service, which features were most used, and what experiences led to customer friction or trouble. o Functional knowledge of cloud computing and online services business models, including business, technical, financial, and operational measurements. o Prior experience in building customer journey mapping / customer funnels utilizing graph db technologies (ex: Azure Cosmos, Neo4J, AWS Neptune, etc.).o Experience applying learnings from data analysis towards optimizing the customer lifecycle. Personal Attributes / Interpersonal Skills:  o Grounded in a growth mindset, advocate for inclusion and diversity, and strong self-awareness. o Excellent written and oral communication skills, particularly the ability to synthesize complex problems/scenarios into easy-to-understand concepts. Able to deliver compelling presentations and experience engaging with audiences of all levels. o Effective in rapidly evolving environments and working across organizational boundaries. o Creative, innovative, organized thinker, with a high attention to detail and self-driven. o Effective time management in complex, ambiguous, deadline-driven environments. o A great teammate who seeks out collaboration opportunities, upholds a safe working environment, and values inclusivity in the workplace. o Possess an entrepreneurial spirit and willingness to tackle numerous problem spaces and learn on the fly. #mcdsjobs Microsoft is an equal opportunity employer.
